DOC.brief_summary: Laryngeal mask airway is a common tool for airway management during anesthesia in many surgeries. Insertion of laryngeal mask needs deep anesthesia, suppression of airway, stabile hemodynamic response. Many drug regimens has been used for this purpose. This study aimed to compare the insertion conditions of laryngeal mask by using ketamine+propofol versus remifentanil + propofol.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Ketamine+Propofol vs Remifentanyl+Propofol on Laryngeal Mask Insertion Conditions
DOC.criteria: Surgery requires laryngeal mask Patient refusal, abdominal surgery required muscle relaxant, any allergy to ketamine or remifentanyl
